## Dataframe interchange protocol

In 2021 **Ralf Gommers** from Quansight<br>took on the task to:

. . .

- facilitate the discussion
- to construct a **dataframe interchange protocol**
- allow converting one type of dataframe into another

---

## Adopting a wider standard

**Joris Van den Bossche** and **Will Jones**

. . .

- wanted to use the Apache Arrow columnar format

. . . 

- de facto standard
- all about zero-copy

Enable data interchange without the need to depend on PyArrow.

---

## Arrow PyCapsule protocol

. . .

**C data interface**<br>
Implemented in 2020 by **Antoine Pitrou**<br>
<span style="color: gray; font-size: 85%;">Inspired by the Python buffer protocol.<br>Later additions: C stream interface and C device interface<br></span>

. . .

**Capsules**<br>
<span style="color: gray; font-size: 85%;">part of Python C API</span><br>
Envelopes for the C Data Interface structs

---

## Example before

```{.python code-line-numbers="5,8" style="font-size: 1.3em;"}
df_polars = pl.DataFrame({"a": [1,2], "b": [0.1, 0.2]})

# Convert polars do datafusion
ctx = datafusion.SessionContext()
df_datafusion = ctx.from_arrow(df_polars.to_arrow())

# and convert back to polars
pl.DataFrame(df_datafusion.to_arrow_table())
```

---

## Example after

```{.python code-line-numbers="5,8" style="font-size: 1.3em;"}
df_polars = pl.DataFrame({"a": [1,2], "b": [0.1, 0.2]})

# Convert polars do datafusion
ctx = datafusion.SessionContext()
df_datafusion = ctx.from_arrow(df_polars)

# and convert back to polars
pl.DataFrame(df_datafusion)
```
